page_content:
Subscription Plans and Pricing
            
            Our platform offers several subscription tiers for developers building LLM applications:
            
            Free Tier:
            - Open source library usage (MIT/Apache 2.0 license)
            - 1,000 API credits per month
            - Community support via GitHub
            - Self-hosted deployment
            
            Pro Tier ($29/month):
            - Everything in Free
            - 100,000 API credits per month
            - Priority email support
            - Advanced analytics and monitoring
            - Cloud deployment option
            
            Business Tier ($99/month):
            - Everything in Pro
            - 500,000 API credits per month
            - Priority phone and email support
            - Team collaboration features
            - Custom integrations
            - SLA guarantee
            
            Enterprise (Custom pricing):
            - Unlimited API credits
            - Dedicated account manager
            - Custom agreements and SLAs
            - On-premise deployment
            - White-label options
            
            All plans include access to our open source libraries. Only cloud features and usage-based API credits require a paid subscription.

API Credits and Usage-Based Billing
            
            API credits are consumed when using our cloud API services:
            - 1 credit = 1 API call
            - Credits reset monthly on your billing date
            - Unused credits do not roll over
            - Overage charges apply if you exceed your limit
            
            Overage charges (Pro plan):
            - First 100k credits: Included
            - Additional credits: $0.0003 per credit
            
            Tracking usage:
            1. Log into dashboard
            2. Navigate to Usage & Billing
            3. View real-time credit consumption
            
            To prevent overage:
            - Set up usage alerts in settings
            - Monitor dashboard regularly
            - Upgrade plan if consistently over limit
            
            Open source libraries can be used without consuming credits when self-hosting.

Subscription Management
            
            To upgrade or downgrade your subscription:
            1. Log into your account
            2. Go to Settings > Billing > Subscription
            3. Click "Change Plan"
            4. Select new tier
            5. Confirm changes
            
            Changes take effect immediately, with prorated billing:
            - Downgrades: Credit to next billing cycle
            - Upgrades: Immediate access, prorated charge
            - Switch to annual plans: Immediate discount applied
            
            To cancel subscription:
            1. Settings > Billing > Subscription
            2. Click "Cancel Subscription"
            3. Choose immediate cancel or cancel at period end
            
            Note: Cancellation preserves open source library access. Only cloud features are disabled.
            
            Billing cycles: Monthly subscriptions renew on the same date each month.

Refund Policy
            
            Subscription-based SaaS refund policy:
            
            Eligibility:
            - Refunds available within 7 days of purchase for new subscriptions only
            - Partial refunds for annual plans if canceling mid-cycle (unused portion)
            - No refunds for usage-based charges (API credits consumed)
            
            Process:
            1. Contact support through dashboard
            2. Provide reason and account details
            3. Review within 2 business days
            4. If approved, refund issued within 5-7 business days
            
            Special circumstances:
            - Extended outages: We offer service credits
            - Billing errors: Immediate refund and correction
            - Duplicate charges: Full refund of duplicates
            
            Open source libraries: No refunds needed as they're free and open source.
            
            Refunds issued to original payment method only.

Payment Issues and Failed Charges
            
            Common payment failure reasons:
            - Expired credit card
            - Insufficient funds
            - Card declined by bank
            - International payment restrictions
            
            What happens:
            - Service continues for 7 days after failed payment
            - Email notifications sent daily
            - Automatic retry after 3 days
            - Account suspended after 7 days if unpaid
            
            Resolution steps:
            1. Update payment method immediately
            2. Settings > Billing > Payment Methods
            3. Click "Update Card"
            4. Enter new payment details
            5. Save and verify
            
            If card continues to decline:
            - Contact your bank to allow recurring charges
            - Try alternative payment method
            - Contact support for manual payment processing
            
            Account restoration:
            - Immediate restoration once payment succeeds
            - No data loss during suspension
            - Usage history preserved

Team and Seat Management
            
            Enterprise and Business plans support multiple team members:
            
            Adding team members:
            1. Settings > Team Management
            2. Click "Invite Member"
            3. Enter email and assign role
            4. User receives invitation email
            
            Roles and permissions:
            - Admin: Full access to billing and settings
            - Developer: API access, cannot modify billing
            - Viewer: Read-only dashboard access
            
            Seat limits:
            - Business: Up to 5 team members
            - Enterprise: Unlimited team members
            - Free/Pro: Single user accounts
            
            Seating charges (Business plan):
            - First 5 users included in subscription
            - Additional users: $10 per user per month
            
            Removing team members:
            1. Navigate to Team Management
            2. Click member to remove
            3. Click "Remove Access"
            4. Confirm removal
            
            Billing updates automatically based on seat count.

Open Source Licensing vs Paid Features
            
            Understanding what's free vs paid:
            
            Open Source (Always Free):
            - LLM application libraries (MIT/Apache 2.0)
            - GitHub repository access
            - Community documentation
            - Self-hosted deployment
            - Building and running applications locally
            - No credit consumption for local usage
            
            Paid Cloud Features (Requires Subscription):
            - Managed cloud API endpoints
            - Usage-based API credits
            - Team collaboration tools
            - Advanced monitoring and analytics
            - Priority support
            - SLA guarantees
            
            Mixing free and paid:
            - You can use open source libraries in paid applications
            - Cloud API usage requires paid subscription
            - Local development is always free
            - Production deployments can be self-hosted (free) or cloud (paid)
            
            Licensing for your applications:
            - You maintain full ownership of your code
            - Open source library license applies to library code only
            - Your application code remains your property
            - No revenue share or usage restrictions on your apps

Invoices and Export for Taxes
            
            Access billing documents:
            1. Log into dashboard
            2. Settings > Billing > Invoices
            3. View or download PDF invoices
            
            Invoice details include:
            - Invoice number and date
            - Subscription period
            - API usage breakdown (if applicable)
            - Amount charged
            - Payment method
            - Transaction ID
            - Tax information (if applicable)
            
            Exporting for accounting:
            - Download individual invoices as PDF
            - Export bulk invoice data as CSV
            - Transactions include line items for credits/usage
            
            Billing address updates:
            - Settings > Billing > Company Information
            - Update billing address for invoices
            - Changes reflect on next billing cycle
            
            International customers:
            - US customers: Sales tax applied in applicable states
            - International: Reverse charge applies (no VAT)
            - Enterprise customers: Custom invoicing available
            
            Available for 7 years for tax purposes.

Enterprise Agreements and Custom Billing
            
            Enterprise customers get custom arrangements:
            
            Custom agreements available for:
            - Annual or multi-year contracts
            - Volume-based pricing
            - Custom SLA requirements
            - On-premise or dedicated infrastructure
            - Professional services and training
            
            Billing options:
            - Net-30, Net-60 terms available
            - Purchase orders accepted
            - Invoice billing (no credit card required)
            - ACH/wire transfer preferred
            
            Enterprise features:
            - Dedicated infrastructure and support
            - Custom integration assistance
            - White-label deployment options
            - Extended support hours (24/7)
            - Custom development requests
            
            Contact sales:
            - Schedule discovery call through dashboard
            - Email: enterprise@yourcompany.com
            - Sales responds within 24 hours
            
            No commitment to discuss options.
            Typical minimum: $500/month for custom agreements.

Downgrades and Changing Plans
            
            Switching subscription tiers:
            
            Downgrading:
            - Changes take effect at end of current billing period
            - You keep full access until period ends
            - Prorated credit applied to next billing cycle
            - Setup downgrade reminder in dashboard
            
            Upgrading:
            - Immediate access to new tier features
            - Prorated charge to account balance
            - New billing cycle starts immediately
            - Previous tier's unused credits reset
            
            Switching to annual:
            - Save 20% compared to monthly
            - Charges applied immediately
            - 12-month billing cycle starts
            - Auto-renew enabled
            
            Impact on open source libraries:
            - Library access unaffected by plan changes
            - Local development continues as normal
            - Only cloud API access changes with tier
            
            Best practices:
            - Monitor usage before downgrading
            - Contact support to discuss options
            - Use usage alerts to track consumption
            
            No penalty for plan changes - adjust as your needs change.

Disputes, Chargebacks, and Billing Errors
            
            Handling billing disputes:
            
            If charged incorrectly:
            1. Review invoice in dashboard
            2. Check usage logs and transaction history
            3. Contact support with invoice number and details
            4. We investigate within 2 business days
            
            Common issues we resolve quickly:
            - Duplicate charges: Immediate refund
            - Charges for canceled accounts: Full refund
            - Credit miscalculations: Corrected immediately
            - Tax calculation errors: Adjusted and refunded
            
            Dispute process:
            - Email billing disputes to billing@yourcompany.com
            - Include account email and invoice number
            - We respond within 48 hours
            - Most disputes resolved within 5 business days
            
            Chargebacks (avoid these):
            - If you initiate a chargeback instead of contacting us
            - Your account may be suspended
            - We will provide evidence to payment processor
            - Better to contact us directly for faster resolution
            
            Our commitment:
            - We investigate all disputes fairly
            - Honest mistakes corrected immediately
            - No fees for legitimate errors on our part
            - Transparent billing and usage tracking
            
            For legal or compliance questions, contact legal@yourcompany.com

Annual vs Monthly Billing
            
            Choosing between annual and monthly billing:
            
            Monthly billing:
            - Pay $29/month for Pro, $99/month for Business
            - Flexibility to cancel anytime
            - No long-term commitment
            - Higher total cost over 12 months
            
            Annual billing:
            - Save 20% compared to monthly plans
            - Pro: $278/year (vs $348 monthly)
            - Business: $949/year (vs $1,188 monthly)
            - Payment charged upfront for full year
            - Auto-renewal enabled by default
            
            Switching to annual:
            1. Settings > Billing > Subscription
            2. Click "Switch to Annual"
            3. Confirm payment for annual amount
            4. Immediate 20% discount applied
            5. Next renewal date set for 12 months
            
            Switching to monthly:
            - Can switch at end of annual period
            - Prorated refund not available
            - Can downgrade to monthly after annual period ends
            
            Benefits of annual:
            - Significant cost savings
            - Fewer billing transactions
            - Better for budget planning
            - Same features, lower cost

Usage Monitoring and Alerts
            
            Track your API credit usage in real-time:
            
            Dashboard monitoring:
            - Real-time credit consumption display
            - Daily, weekly, monthly usage graphs
            - Usage trends and predictions
            - Breakdown by API endpoint
            - Access via Settings > Usage & Billing
            
            Setting up usage alerts:
            1. Navigate to Settings > Billing > Usage Alerts
            2. Click "Create Alert"
            3. Set threshold (e.g., 80% of plan limit)
            4. Choose notification method (email, SMS)
            5. Save alert settings
            
            Alert thresholds:
            - 50% usage: Early warning
            - 80% usage: Approaching limit
            - 95% usage: Near overage
            - 100% usage: Limit reached
            
            Preventing overage charges:
            - Set alerts at 80% and 95%
            - Monitor dashboard weekly
            - Review usage patterns monthly
            - Upgrade plan before hitting limit
            - Consider usage optimization strategies
            
            Usage reports:
            - Download CSV reports for any date range
            - Export for accounting purposes
            - Track team member usage (Business/Enterprise)
            - Historical data available for 12 months

Trial Periods and Promotional Offers
            
            Free trial information:
            
            New account trials:
            - 14-day free trial available for Pro plan
            - Full access to all Pro features
            - No credit card required to start
            - 100,000 trial API credits included
            - Auto-converts to paid plan after trial
            
            Trial cancellation:
            - Cancel before trial ends to avoid charges
            - Settings > Billing > Cancel Subscription
            - Account reverts to Free tier
            - Keep access to open source libraries
            - No charges if cancelled during trial
            
            Promotional codes:
            - Enter codes at checkout or in billing settings
            - Valid for new subscriptions only
            - Typically 10-25% discount
            - Cannot combine with annual plan discount
            - Expiration dates apply
            
            Student discounts:
            - 50% off Pro plan for verified students
            - Valid .edu email required
            - Submit student ID for verification
            - Discount applies for up to 4 years
            - Contact support@yourcompany.com to apply
            
            Startup credits:
            - Apply for startup program credits
            - Available for early-stage companies
            - Up to $500 in API credits
            - Submit application via dashboard
            - Review within 5 business days

Auto-Renewal Settings
            
            Managing automatic subscription renewal:
            
            How auto-renewal works:
            - Subscriptions automatically renew at end of billing cycle
            - Charges processed to default payment method
            - Email notification sent 3 days before renewal
            - Renewal date shown in billing dashboard
            - Failure to renew suspends paid features
            
            Turning off auto-renewal:
            1. Settings > Billing > Subscription
            2. Click "Auto-Renewal Settings"
            3. Toggle off "Auto-renew subscription"
            4. Confirm cancellation at period end
            5. Receive confirmation email
            
            What happens when auto-renewal is off:
            - Subscription continues until period ends
            - No charges after current period
            - Access to paid features ends on renewal date
            - Account reverts to Free tier automatically
            - Open source library access preserved
            
            Re-enabling auto-renewal:
            - Toggle back on before period ends
            - Immediate charge to current payment method
            - Service continues uninterrupted
            - Can enable up to renewal date
            
            Renewal notifications:
            - Email 7 days before renewal
            - Email 3 days before renewal
            - Email on successful renewal
            - Email if renewal fails
            - Update email in account settings

Billing Date Changes
            
            Understanding and changing your billing date:
            
            Default billing dates:
            - Monthly plans: Same day each month as original signup
            - Annual plans: Same date each year
            - Based on UTC timezone
            - Charges processed at 00:00 UTC on billing date
            - Cannot change to arbitrary dates
            
            Changing billing date:
            - Email billing@yourcompany.com with request
            - Include desired billing date (1-28 of month)
            - Processed within 2 business days
            - Next cycle adjusts to new date
            - Cannot change more than once per quarter
            
            Proration when changing date:
            - Current period charges prorated
            - Credit or charge applied to account
            - New billing cycle starts on new date
            - No loss of service during adjustment
            - Detailed explanation in invoice
            
            Business considerations:
            - Useful for aligning with fiscal periods
            - Coordinate with accounting cycles
            - Monthly billing dates fixed per account
            - Annual plans not affected
            
            Limitations:
            - Cannot set date to 29-31 (defaults to month end)
            - Change takes effect next billing cycle
            - Enterprise customers: Contact account manager
            - Frequent changes may require support approval

Payment Methods Management
            
            Managing payment methods for your account:
            
            Supported payment methods:
            - Credit cards: Visa, Mastercard, American Express
            - Debit cards with credit card logos
            - PayPal (select plans only)
            - ACH/wire transfer (Enterprise customers)
            - Invoice billing (Enterprise only)
            
            Adding a payment method:
            1. Settings > Billing > Payment Methods
            2. Click "Add Payment Method"
            3. Enter card details or select PayPal
            4. Set as default if desired
            5. Save payment information
            
            Default payment method:
            - Used for all automatic charges
            - Renewal charges processed to default
            - Overage charges use default method
            - Can change default anytime
            - Multiple cards can be stored
            
            Updating payment method:
            - Click "Edit" on existing card
            - Update expiration date or card number
            - Verify with bank if needed
            - Old card remains until new one verified
            - Automatic switch once verified
            
            Removing payment method:
            - Cannot remove if it's the only method
            - Add new method before removing old
            - Click "Remove" on payment card
            - Confirms removal action
            - Billing switches to next available method
            
            Security:
            - Payment details encrypted and tokenized
            - PCI-DSS compliant storage
            - Never stored on our servers directly
            - Managed by Stripe payment processor

Overage Billing Details
            
            Understanding overage charges:
            
            What is overage:
            - Charges when you exceed plan credit limits
            - Applies after monthly credit allocation used
            - Calculated per API call beyond limit
            - Billed separately from subscription
            - Shows as line item on invoice
            
            Overage pricing by plan:
            - Free Tier: No overage allowed, service stops at limit
            - Pro Plan: $0.0003 per credit after 100,000
            - Business Plan: $0.0002 per credit after 500,000
            - Enterprise: Negotiated rates, typically volume discounts
            
            How overage is charged:
            - Calculated daily based on usage
            - Added to next monthly invoice
            - Real-time tracking in dashboard
            - Daily email summaries during overage period
            - Can set hard limits to prevent overage
            
            Preventing overage:
            - Set usage alerts at 80% and 95%
            - Enable hard limit (stops service at 100%)
            - Upgrade plan before exceeding limit
            - Monitor dashboard regularly
            - Optimize API usage to reduce calls
            
            Hard limit option:
            - Available in Billing > Usage Settings
            - Stops API calls at plan limit
            - Prevents unexpected charges
            - Can enable/disable anytime
            - Enterprise customers: Custom limits available
            
            Overage disputes:
            - Review usage logs if unexpected
            - Contact support with invoice number
            - We verify and explain charges
            - Legitimate usage charges apply
            - Billing errors corrected immediately

Budget and Spending Limits
            
            Setting spending controls for your account:
            
            Monthly spending limits:
            - Set maximum monthly budget
            - Applies to subscription + overage charges
            - Service stops when limit reached
            - Available for Pro and Business plans
            - Reset monthly on billing date
            
            Setting a budget:
            1. Settings > Billing > Budget & Limits
            2. Click "Set Monthly Budget"
            3. Enter maximum amount
            4. Choose action at limit (stop service or alert only)
            5. Save budget settings
            
            Budget alerts:
            - Email notification at 50% of budget
            - Email notification at 80% of budget
            - Email notification at 95% of budget
            - Email when limit reached
            - Dashboard shows budget vs actual spending
            
            Hard vs soft limits:
            - Hard limit: Service stops at budget
            - Soft limit: Alerts only, service continues
            - Can switch anytime
            - Hard limit prevents unexpected charges
            - Soft limit for monitoring only
            
            Budget management:
            - Increase budget anytime
            - Decrease budget takes effect next cycle
            - Budget resets monthly automatically
            - Historical spending data available
            - Export budget reports for accounting
            
            Enterprise budgets:
            - Custom budget controls
            - Per-project or per-team budgets
            - Organization-wide limits
            - Advanced reporting and alerts
            - Contact account manager for setup

Billing History and Statements
            
            Accessing your billing history:
            
            Viewing billing history:
            - Settings > Billing > Billing History
            - See all past invoices and charges
            - Filter by date range or type
            - Sort by date, amount, or status
            - Available for all active and closed accounts
            
            Invoice details:
            - Invoice number and date
            - Subscription period covered
            - Base subscription charge
            - Overage charges breakdown
            - Tax calculations
            - Payment method used
            - Transaction ID
            
            Downloading invoices:
            - Click "Download PDF" on any invoice
            - Bulk download available (select multiple)
            - Export as CSV for accounting software
            - Email invoices to billing contacts
            - Print-friendly format included
            
            Billing statements:
            - Monthly summary statements available
            - Year-end statements for tax purposes
            - Request via Settings > Billing > Statements
            - Generated within 24 hours
            - Include all transactions for period
            
            Retention period:
            - Invoices available for 7 years
            - Download and save important invoices
            - Historical data preserved
            - Closed accounts retain access for 90 days
            - Contact support for older records
            
            Credit memos:
            - Appear as negative charges
            - Issued for refunds or adjustments
            - Show reason for credit
            - Included in monthly statements
            - Downloadable like regular invoices

Account Closure and Data Retention
            
            Closing your account and data policies:
            
            Closing an account:
            1. Cancel subscription first (if active)
            2. Settings > Account > Close Account
            3. Confirm account closure
            4. Enter reason (optional)
            5. Final confirmation required
            
            What happens immediately:
            - All paid features disabled
            - API access suspended
            - Data export available for 30 days
            - Billing history accessible for 90 days
            - Open source library access continues
            
            Data retention after closure:
            - Account data: 90 days
            - Billing records: 7 years (legal requirement)
            - Usage logs: 30 days
            - Application data: 30 days (export available)
            - Permanent deletion after retention period
            
            Exporting your data:
            - Request data export before closure
            - Available in Settings > Account > Data Export
            - Includes all application data
            - JSON format for easy migration
            - Generated within 48 hours
            
            Reactivating closed accounts:
            - Can reactivate within 90 days
            - Contact support to restore
            - Billing history preserved
            - Restore subscription if desired
            - Data recovery possible if within retention
            
            Final billing:
            - Prorated refund for unused subscription time
            - Any outstanding charges must be paid
            - Final invoice issued
            - Payment methods removed after closure
            - Receipts saved for tax records

Currency and International Billing
            
            Billing for international customers:
            
            Supported currencies:
            - USD (US Dollars) - default
            - EUR (Euros)
            - GBP (British Pounds)
            - CAD (Canadian Dollars)
            - AUD (Australian Dollars)
            
            Currency selection:
            - Set during account signup
            - Change in Settings > Billing > Currency
            - Prices converted at current exchange rates
            - Rates updated daily
            - Historical invoices show original currency
            
            Exchange rates:
            - Market rates updated daily
            - Based on mid-market rates
            - No markup or fees on conversion
            - Rates locked at time of charge
            - Shown in checkout before payment
            
            International payment methods:
            - Credit cards with international access
            - Some cards may have foreign transaction fees (bank dependent)
            - PayPal available for select regions
            - Wire transfers for Enterprise (USD only)
            - Check with your bank about fees
            
            Tax handling:
            - US customers: Sales tax in applicable states
            - EU customers: VAT reverse charge (B2B)
            - International: Generally no tax collected
            - Enterprise: Custom tax arrangements
            - Consult tax advisor for your jurisdiction
            
            Regional pricing:
            - Base prices in USD
            - Converted to local currency at checkout
            - May vary slightly with exchange rates
            - Enterprise: Custom pricing available
            - Contact sales for volume discounts

Billing Contacts and Notifications
            
            Managing billing contacts and email preferences:
            
            Primary billing contact:
            - Account owner email (default)
            - Receives all billing notifications
            - Receives invoices and receipts
            - Receives payment failure alerts
            - Can be changed in account settings
            
            Adding billing contacts:
            1. Settings > Billing > Billing Contacts
            2. Click "Add Contact"
            3. Enter email address
            4. Select notification types
            5. Save contact
            
            Notification types:
            - Invoice notifications
            - Payment confirmations
            - Failed payment alerts
            - Usage alerts (if enabled)
            - Billing date reminders
            - Subscription changes
            
            Email preferences:
            - Enable/disable specific notification types
            - Choose frequency (instant, daily digest)
            - Update in Settings > Notifications
            - Can unsubscribe from marketing emails
            - Billing emails cannot be disabled (required)
            
            Enterprise billing contacts:
            - Multiple billing contacts allowed
            - Department-specific notifications
            - Custom email templates available
            - Accounting team integration
            - Contact account manager for setup
            
            Updating contact information:
            - Change email in Settings > Account
            - Update billing address in Billing settings
            - Changes apply to future invoices
            - Historical invoices unchanged
            - Verify new email address

Service Credits and Compensatory Adjustments
            
            Understanding service credits:
            
            What are service credits:
            - Credits applied to account for service issues
            - Issued for extended outages or problems
            - Applied automatically or manually
            - Offset future subscription charges
            - Shown as line item on invoices
            
            When credits are issued:
            - Extended service outages (>2 hours)
            - SLA violations (Enterprise customers)
            - Billing errors on our part
            - Duplicate charges
            - Account suspension errors
            
            How credits are applied:
            - Automatically applied to next invoice
            - Reduce subscription charge
            - Cannot exceed invoice amount
            - Unused credits carry forward
            - Visible in billing dashboard
            
            Requesting a credit:
            - Contact support with issue details
            - Provide outage times or error details
            - We review and determine eligibility
            - Credit issued within 5 business days
            - Email notification sent when issued
            
            Credit policies:
            - Proactive credits for major issues
            - Reactive credits upon request
            - Enterprise SLA credits automatic
            - No credits for planned maintenance
            - Credits non-transferable and non-refundable
            
            Viewing service credits:
            - Settings > Billing > Credits
            - See pending and applied credits
            - Credits history available
            - Expiration dates shown
            - Export credit report available

Proration and Billing Adjustments
            
            Understanding prorated charges:
            
            When proration occurs:
            - Plan upgrades mid-cycle
            - Plan downgrades mid-cycle
            - Adding team members mid-cycle
            - Removing team members mid-cycle
            - Billing date changes
            
            How proration is calculated:
            - Based on days remaining in billing cycle
            - Daily rate = monthly price / days in month
            - Upgrade: Charge difference for remaining days
            - Downgrade: Credit difference for remaining days
            - Shown on next invoice with explanation
            
            Upgrade proration example:
            - Upgrade from Pro ($29) to Business ($99) on day 15 of 30-day month
            - Daily difference: ($99 - $29) / 30 = $2.33/day
            - Charge for 15 days: $2.33 Ã— 15 = $34.95
            - Immediate access to Business features
            - Full Business charge on next billing date
            
            Downgrade proration example:
            - Downgrade from Business ($99) to Pro ($29) on day 20
            - Credit difference: ($99 - $29) / 30 = $2.33/day
            - Credit for 10 remaining days: $23.30
            - Applied to next billing cycle
            - Pro features activate at period end
            
            Viewing prorated amounts:
            - Shown on invoice as separate line item
            - Detailed breakdown in invoice notes
            - "Prorated adjustment" label
            - Can review in billing history
            - Contact support with questions
            
            Annual plan proration:
            - Upgrades: Prorated to annual rate
            - Downgrades: Credit based on remaining annual value
            - More complex calculations
            - Detailed explanation provided
            - Contact support for clarification

Add-Ons and Additional Features
            
            Additional services and feature purchases:
            
            Available add-ons:
            - Extra API credits (one-time purchase)
            - Additional team seats (monthly)
            - Premium support tiers
            - Custom integrations
            - Priority feature requests
            
            Purchasing extra credits:
            1. Settings > Billing > Add-ons
            2. Select "Additional API Credits"
            3. Choose credit package (10k, 50k, 100k)
            4. Complete purchase
            5. Credits added immediately
            
            Credit package pricing:
            - 10,000 credits: $5
            - 50,000 credits: $20
            - 100,000 credits: $35
            - One-time purchases
            - Credits expire after 90 days if unused
            
            Additional team seats:
            - Business plan: $10/user/month
            - Enterprise: Custom pricing
            - Prorated if added mid-cycle
            - Billed with subscription
            - Remove anytime (ends at period end)
            
            Premium support:
            - Phone support: $49/month
            - 24/7 support: $99/month
            - Available for Pro and Business
            - Enterprise includes premium support
            - Can cancel anytime
            
            Managing add-ons:
            - View active add-ons in Billing dashboard

Billing Cycle Explained
            
            Understanding billing cycles:
            
            Monthly billing cycle:
            - Starts on signup date or plan change date
            - Runs for 30-31 days depending on month
            - Renews automatically on same date each month
            - Charges processed at 00:00 UTC
            - Invoice generated on billing date
            
            Annual billing cycle:
            - 365-day cycle (366 in leap years)
            - Starts on signup or plan change date
            - Renews on same date each year
            - Single charge for full year
            - Invoice generated annually
            
            Cycle timing:
            - Billing date = renewal date
            - Charges processed same day
            - API credits reset on billing date
            - Usage resets at midnight UTC
            - New cycle starts immediately after charge
            
            Mid-cycle changes:
            - Upgrades: Immediate access, prorated charge
            - Downgrades: Access until period end, credit issued
            - Add-ons: Prorated if added mid-cycle
            - Cancellation: Service until period end
            - Plan changes reset credit allocations
            
            Tracking your cycle:
            - Dashboard shows current cycle dates
            - Days remaining in cycle displayed
            - Usage percentage vs cycle limit
            - Next billing date clearly shown
            - Email reminders before billing date
            
            Cycle synchronization:
            - All charges synchronized to billing date
            - Overage charges added to next invoice
            - Add-ons billed on main billing date
            - Team seat changes prorated to billing date
            - Cannot change cycle frequency mid-term

Payment Schedule and Timing
            
            Understanding when charges occur:
            
            Regular subscription charges:
            - Processed on billing date
            - Monthly: Same date each month
            - Annual: Same date each year
            - Time: 00:00 UTC (may vary by timezone)
            - Processing takes 1-3 business days
            
            Immediate charges:
            - Plan upgrades: Charged immediately
            - Add-on purchases: Charged immediately
            - Extra credit purchases: Charged immediately
            - One-time payments: Processed immediately
            - Invoice generated within minutes
            
            Overage charges:
            - Calculated daily during billing cycle
            - Added to next monthly invoice
            - Not charged separately
            - Included in billing date invoice
            - Detailed breakdown provided
            
            Prorated charges:
            - Applied when making mid-cycle changes
            - Charged immediately for upgrades
            - Credited for downgrades (next invoice)
            - Shown on next regular invoice
            - Separate line item for clarity
            
            Payment processing time:
            - Credit card: 1-3 business days
            - PayPal: 1-2 business days
            - ACH (Enterprise): 3-5 business days
            - Wire transfer: 5-7 business days
            - International: May take longer
            
            Failed payment retry:
            - Automatic retry after 3 days
            - Up to 3 retry attempts
            - Daily email notifications
            - Account suspended after 7 days
            - Update payment method to restore
            
            Scheduled payments:
            - Cannot schedule future payments
            - All charges automatic or immediate
            - Enterprise: Custom payment terms available
            - Contact account manager for options
